ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great comprehensive introductory course to the study of lithics.
I would absolutely recommend this class to anyone who works on a site with stone tools or even anyone interested in stone tool making.

ANTH 750 01 is an interesting course for a student interested not only in lithic studies but also in geochemical analysis studies as well. The workshops on knapping stone tools were very informative. I highly recommend this course to whoever interested in these issues, unless the student hates intensive readings!
Definitely I will recommend the course, since it involves many aspects in the lithic study, which will also be beneficial in the whole archaeological study.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course is directly relevant to my research.
The course gave me a sight on how to approach and interepret lithic artifacts in general

I think the course involves many aspects in the lithic study, like the sourcing analysis and use wear analysis, which will all give us a more integrated view of its importance in the archaeological studies.
